metadata.title: CVE-2022-33070 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Protobuf-c v1.4.0 was discovered to contain an invalid arithmetic shift viathe function parse_tag_and_wiretype in protobuf-c/protobuf-c.c. Thisvulnerability allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-33070` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libprotobuf-c1 - 1.3.3-1ubuntu2.1
protobuf-c-compiler - 1.3.3-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

sudo - 1.9.9-1ubuntu2.2
sudo-ldap - 1.9.9-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgadu package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
pidgin package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
protobuf-c package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.3-1ubuntu2.1').
libpg-query package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
sudo package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.9-1ubuntu2.2').
argyll package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
libsignal-protocol-c package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
ocserv package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
ccextractor package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
